fluff.name: Aegis
entries: A burly dwarf clad in plate armor jumps in front of a massive mammoth to shield a lost child on a snow-covered mountain.
A fierce human sends a blast of his spirit towards a hellish orc, pushing him into the blade of his fellow paladin, taking his head clean off
Pushing his fellow adventurers to their limits with his inspirational cries, a barbarian is able to overpower an adult dragon with a single blow because of the spirit the tall elf gives to him.

The Aegis. One who claims to have found some proof that something, or some being, is out there, and being hidden. That this is the real truth. That it is the real power. Concepts of good and evil, varying government types, and even simply the way we go about life are all a fallacy to an aegis.

Because of this, the aegis has committed their entire being to protecting those who they believe are lost to the world, using any means necessart and knowledge they have gained in their search for truth. But the question is, are aegis the ones who are really under a fallacy?

entries.name: A Deep Caring for all Living Beings
entries: Many talk of being saved by an iron-clad warrior, in the face of almost certain death, and then never seeing this adventurer again once the danger is taken care of.

The knowledge they have gained in their travels has aegis believing that most others have no idea of what's truly going on in the multiverse. They believe that lies surround us, and because of this, see others as almost children in a dream.

Aegis take it upon themselves to do everything they can to protect these dreamers at all costs, even if it costs their own lives, but in the hope for that individual to find the truth, as well as be awoken.

entries.name: A Solitary Life of Searching
entries: An aegis has spent a majority of their life searching for a greater truth. Some event in the past has shown the aegis that the beliefs of the worlds seem to be nothing more than shackles for more powerful beings to use against us. Primarily beings who are revered, such as deities, demons, devils, and prominent figures.

Being very few and far between, the aegis normally lives a solitary life, and even when they do find other aegis, they normally do not stick together for long as they are all searching for the proof that will finally show everyone that what they have always believed in was a lie.

They do understand, however, that the answers they may personally seek do require skills beyond what they themselves can do, so they do often partner with other adventurers so they can obtain the proof they need to their questions.

entries.name: Creating an Aegis
entries: When creating an aegis, contemplate what event, as well as what higher being, natural event, or prominent figure it was that caused you to seek the truth. Once you have realized that truth, then think of what proof you exactly found. Was it some ancient hieroglyph scrawled across a wall in a deep cave you found, a hidden jar containing very ancient texts that was hidden in a church to a specific higher being, or even a dream.

When did you first realize further that your belief would provide you a power that was unheard of and allowed you to tap into a spirit you never even knew you had? Were you being pursued by others who were going to persecute you because of your beliefs, and your petition to this unknown belief manifested new abilities. Or maybe laying down the night after finding further proof, you were provided a vision which showed you your abilities, thus pushing you to find and control that power further.

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can make an aegis quickly by following these suggestions. First, Constitution should be your highest ability score to increase your hit points and AC to be able to provice the most protection, followed by Intelligence. Second, choose the {@background hermit} background.

classFeature.name: Safeguard
entries: Beginning at 1st level, when danger is present, you protect others with everything you have and without any thought for yourself.
On your turn you can enter Safeguard as a bonus action. While in safeguard, you gain the following benefits:

items: As a reaction, when an attack is declared on a creature within 5 feet of you, you can provide cover to that creature. The effects of your cover are determined by your Shield Art and last until the end of the current turn, but can only be used once per round.
If an armor you wear requires you to add your Dexterity modifier to get your total AC, add your Constitution modifier instead.
You have advantage on saving throws and ability checks against being shoved or knocked prone.
entries: Safeguard lasts for 1 minute. It ends early if you are knocked unconscious. You are able to end Safeguard on your turn as a bonus action.
While in Safeguard, you can use your Intelligence modifier when determining attack and damage for a weapon you are proficient with while using your shield art.

classFeature.name: Shield Arts
entries: The details of how you Safeguard with your selected shield art are shown below, as well as any additional benefits provided by your choice. Once selected, you cannot change your shield art at any point

entries.name: Balwark
entries: You are proficient with tower shields, a heavier and stronger protection. While wielding this shield, you can use an action to raise it, causing attackers to have disadvantage and you to have advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and can use a bonus action to lower the shield again.
While you hold the shield up, your movement becomes 0, but you can use a dash action to move.

Additionally, you can provide full cover to a creature who is within 5 feet of you as a reaction. The target creature cannot be targetted by an attack or spell, although some spells can reach a target by including it in an area of effect

entries.name: Dual Shield
entries: When using this shield art, you can wield a shield in each hand, but do not gain the AC bonus from the secondary shield.
While wielding a shield in each hand this way, the second shield is considered a simple melee weapon, and deals 1d6 bludgeoning damage on a hit.
Additionally, if an attack is rolled against a creature within 5 feet of you, as a reaction you can provide three-quarters cover, which provides a +5 bonus to AC and dexterity saving throws.

entries.name: Weapon and Shield
entries: When using a weapon and shield, if an attack is made against another creature within 5 feet of you, as a reaction you can provide half-cover.
This provides a +2 AC and Dexterity saving throw bonus to the creature. If the creature is hit, you reduce the damage by your Intelligence modifier (minimum 1).

classFeature.name: Vanguard of Protection
entries: At 2nd level you realize your spirit that drives you, and others, is more than just an ideal, and you commit to a way of the vanguard

You can choose the Vanguard of Inspiration, the Vanguard of Displacement, or the Vanguard of The Destroyer, all detailed at the end of the class description. Your vanguard choice grants you additional features at 2nd level and again at 6th, 10th, 14th, and 18th levels.

classFeature.name: Unknown Petitions
entries: Your pleas to the unknown for help against your enemies have been heard and you are now able to call upon your spirit to enhance yourself, and those around you. Starting at 2nd level, you gain 2 unknown petitions of your choice, which are determined by the vanguard you choose.

You unlock two additional petitions at 6th level, and again at 10th, 14th, and 18th levels. These petitions you select are determined by the Vanguard of Protection you choose and are detailed in your vanguard description.

entries.name: Spirit
entries: Your Unknown Petitions are fueled by your Spirit. You can only beseech so many of these petiions before a short or long rest is needed, at which point your spirit points regenerate.

Your spirit level is determined by your aegis level, which determines the number of Spirit points you have to spend, and can be seen under the Spirit Points column in the aegis table. These points can be spent on various petitions that are fueled by your spirit.
When you spend a spirit point, it is not available again until you take a short or long rest. As long as you have spirit points, you have no limit on how many times these petitions can be used.

entries.name: Casting Unknow Petitions
entries: To cast one of the unknown petitions, you must have the required spirit cost available and have a spirit focus present on your character at the time of casting. This can be anything like a book, a relic, or even a torn page of text, but it must be held in one hand. At your DM's permission, a focus such as a torn page or trinket can be attached to a shield or weapon and counts as being held.

classFeature.name: Battle Strategist
entries: Beginning at 3rd level, you've made it a point to setup thebattle field for your allies. You can now add yourIntelligence modifier to initiative rolls (minimum 1).

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Spiritual Insight
entries: At 5th level, when in the presence of a deity, demon, or devil, you are able to see past the facade they put on.
Whenever a celestial or fiend tries to use their will or power to deceive, intimidate, or persuade you, they gain disadvantage on ability checks associated with that skill.
As an action, you can expend one spirit point to extend this ability to a number of creatures equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum 1) for 1 minute.

classFeature.name: Vanguard feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain one feature granted by your Vanguard.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Gliding Spirit
entries: Beginning at 9th level, your spirit automatically reacts for you at times when you or a creature in sight is attacked
If you should be targetted by an attack, you can as a reaction spend one spirit point to move 5 feet in any direction to cause that attack to have disadvantage.
Also, if a creature is attacked within 20 feet of you, you can as a reaction spend two spirit points to move within range of that creature and safeguard it.
can now use an additional reaction each round.

classFeature.name: Vanguard feature
entries: At 10th level, you gain one feature granted by your Vanguard.

classFeature.name: Spirit Armor
entries: Starting at 11th level, after a short or long rest, you can expend two spirit points to have your spirit act as a first line of defense for yourself.

If you would take damage that is equal, or less than your Aegis level + your Constitution modifier (minimum 1), your spirit blocks the damage and you take none. The first time you would take damage that exceeds this threshold, you lose the effect of this armor and that damage is reduced by your threshold until the end of that turn.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Shield Master
entries: At 14th level, you have mastered your Shield Art beyond measure. You can take a third reaction each round. You also gain the following benefits pertaining to the shield art you chose:

entries.name: Balwark
entries: If you should hit a creature with an attack, you can use a bonus action to shove that same creature back 10 feet. You are now able to use Dash and Disengage as additional bonus actions on your turn.

entries.name: Dual Shield
entries: You gain the bonus AC from your second shield and both shields are now considered light melee weapons for the purpose of two-weapon fighting. Both shields now also do 1d8 bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Weapon and Shield
entries: You now have advantage when attacking a creature. If you successfully Safeguard a creature, you can use an additional reaction to attack the creature who attacked. You don't add your ability modifier to the damage of the attack, unless that modifier is negative.

classFeature.name: Vanguard feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain one feature granted by your Vanguard.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Extension of Ones Self
entries: At 17th level, while your Spirit Armor is active, and if you fail to Safeguard a creature and it takes damage, you can use a second reaction and expend three spirit points to transfer your Spirit Armor to the creature until the start of your next turn to attempt to avoid that damage, but this must be done before the damage is calculated. If the armor is not destroyed, it transfers back to you at the beginning of your next turn.

classFeature.name: Vanguard feature
entries: At 18th level, you gain one feature granted by your Vanguard.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Unbreaking Shield
entries: At 20th level, you can now Safeguard a creature within 10 feet of you. Also, if your hit points would drop to 0 while Safeguard is active, you can expend one spirit point and get up with 1 hit point. This can only be used once before a long rest is needed.

subclassFeature.name: Vanguard of Inspiration
entries: Some aegis understand that the beliefs of the world have weakened others and their limits, so they aim to help others go beyond those limits.

The aegis will use their own words, knowhow, and spirit to rally adventurers to do things like increase their power, encourage them to overcome difficult situations, to heal them during combat, or even shield them with their spirit from afar.

subclassFeature.name: Utilitarian
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you realize the importance of having a deep list of petitions to assist those around you. When you would learn two new petitions at 2nd, 6th, 10th, 14th, and 18th levels, you instead learn three and can replace two existing petitions instead of one.

subclassFeature.name: Helping Shield
entries: At 2nd level, you dedicate yourself to the enhancement of those around you so that they have the power to help themselves, at least for the time you are around. This vanguard requires you to spend your spirit points each time you use a petition.

You can now embolden adventurers using several petitions. You choose three petitions when you pick this vanguard, which are detailed in the Embolden Petitions list below. You learn three additional embolden petitions at 6th, 10th, 14th, and 18th level.
Whenever you learn a new embolden petition, you can also replace two embolden petitions you know with a different petitions.

subclassFeature.name: Natural Healer
entries: Beginning at 6th level, you can create special herbal poultices that have healing power comparable to some potions. You can spend 1 hour gathering herbs and preparing herbal poultices using treated bandages to create a number of such poultices equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum 1). You can carry a number of poultices equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum 1).

The poultices you create cannot be applied by anyone but you. After 24 hours, any poultices that you have not used lose their potency. If you spend 1 minute applying one of your poultices to a wounded humanoid creature, thereby expending its use, that creature regains 1d6 hit points for every two aegis levels you have. You can apply poultices during battle to heal yourself or a creature, but it uses an action on your turn, and takes until the end of your next turn to complete. You also cannot move or use other actions during this time.

subclassFeature.name: Proud Spirit
entries: At 10th level, you become so proud of those you inspire, any time a creature in your party kills another creature, you gain back 2 spirit points. The creature that made the kill must have been Safeguarded by you before the turn the kill occurred, and a creature with a CR of 1/2 or higher must have been killed.

subclassFeature.name: Perfected Spirit
entries: At 18th level, you have learned to perfect your control of your Spirit. You can control your Spirit and energy within yourself, and expend three spirit points to use a bonus action on your turn to become ethereal for up to 1 minute, but only if you take the bonus action first on your turn.

During this time, you can not be touched or attacked by other creatures, but you are able to interact with yourself and creatures around you. You can move up to your movement speed on your turn while in Perfected Spirit.

You can still use your unknown petitions and even use your Poultices while in Perfected Spirit, but this effect ends if you attack a target. You can choose to end Perfected Spirit on your turn as a bonus action. This can only be used once before a long rest is needed

subclassFeature.name: Vanguard of Displacement
entries: Most aegis see protecting others as ensuring that they get in between the enemy and those who they are protecting. Other aegis see protecting others as simply ensuring that the enemy gets no where near your fellow adventurers in the first place. These aegis use their spirit to create a type of martial energy that allows them to use force to push and move their enemy. They have learned to harness this energy in different ways, such as small explosions, energy balls, and burning beams, just to name a few.

subclassFeature.name: Opposites Repel
entries: Starting at 2nd level, whenever a creature shoves or pushes you with a melee attack, that creature is also shoved or pushed back the same distance.

subclassFeature.name: Master of Force
entries: At 2nd level, you learn to harness your spirit to create a force that allows you to move your enemy at will. This vanguard requires you to spend your spirit points each time you use a petition.
You can pick two spirit petitions of your choice, which are detailed in the Force Petitions section below. You learn two additional force petitions at 6th, 10th, 14th, and 18th level.
Whenever you learn a new force petition, you can also replace one force petition you know with a different petition.

subclassFeature.name: One With Your Weapon
entries: At 6th level, when you damage a creature with a weapon, that weapon does force damage on top of the weapons normal damage type. On a hit, that creature takes the weapons normal damage + 1d4 force damage and must make a Strength saving throw. If failed, the creature is pushed 5 feet away. You use your Spirit save DC when calculating the Saving throw DC for the creature. You gain an additional 1d4 when you reach 14th level (2d4) and 18th level (3d4).

subclassFeature.name: Self Reflection
entries: Beginning at 10th level, whenever you successfully hit a creature with a melee attack, you can roll double the damage associated with the attack. You do not roll double for force damage provided by One with Your Weapon. You can also choose for your body to radiate your spirit as a dim light in a 10-foot radius around you, in a color of your choice, as a bonus action. You can stop this using a bonus action as well.

subclassFeature.name: Vehement Spirit
entries: At 18th level, your spirit overflows from you whenever you attack a creature. You can expend three spirit points. For 1 minute, your attack range is doubled, and anytime you successfully hit a creature with one of your force petitions, you can roll double the damage associated with the attack. This can only be used once before a long rest is needed

subclassFeature.name: Vanguard of The Destroyer
entries: You see that any being that is out to seek absolute power or to become exalted among all others really seeks one thing. To become a god. And that being will pay. Whether that be a Celestial or Fey. A Demon or Fiend. A king or a wealthy businessman. You will find them and destroy those who stand in your way. You have learned to channel your spirit into a celestial element that destroys the one you seek.

subclassFeature.name: Embrace Both Sides
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you have studied both paths of light and darkness. When you take a short or long rest, you can spend one hour meditating. At the end of your meditation, you can pick one element.

This element is the element that powers your Destruction Petitions. You can choose from Necrotic or Radiant damage. When using your destruction petitions, you use the chosen damage as the type applied to your petition. If the petition would have an effect, when choosing necrotic damage, you would Frighten creatures, and when choosing radiant damage you would Blind creatures.

subclassFeature.name: Master of Destruction
entries: At 2nd level, you learn to destroy and cripple those who would consider themselves a god or oppose you. This vanguard requires you to spend your spirit points each time you use a petition.
You choose two petitions when you pick this vanguard, which are detailed in the Destruction Petitions list below. You learn two additional destruction petitions at 6th, 10th, 14th, and 18th level.
Whenever you learn a new destruction petition, you can also replace one destruction petition you know with a different petition.

subclassFeature.name: Redoubt of Power
entries: Starting at 6th level, attacks that use necrotic or radiant damage have disadvantage against you and you gain advantage on saving throws against necrotic and radiant spells.

subclassFeature.name: Chosen Embrace
entries: At 10th level, you will make your foes feel the pain of their evil and hatred. When choosing Necrotic or Radiant through Embrace Both Sides, you now add double your Intelligence modifier (minimum 2) to the Spirit Save DC or Spirit Attack Modifier of any petition that uses that element.

subclassFeature.name: Destructive Shield
entries: At 18th level, you can expend three spirit points to have an aura of power wreath your body for 1 minute, shedding a bright light in the color related to the element you chose in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. You can end the spell early by using an action to dismiss it.

Depending on your choice, the aura provides you a radiant shield or a necrotic shield. The radiant shield gives you resistance to necrotic damage, and the necrotic shield grants you resistance to radiant damage.

In addition, whenever a creature within 5 feet of you hits you with a melee attack, the shield erupts with the chosen element. The attacker takes 4d8 radiant damage from a radiant shield or 4d8 necrotic damage from a necrotic shield. This can only be used once before a long rest is needed.
